Description: For 1 minute, the $ can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or saving throw. The $ can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the $ A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the hobgoblin is incapacitated.

Name: Spores

A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. Emptying a vial of holy water on the target also ends the effect on it.

Name: Whirlwind

If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes additional bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must make a DC ## Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't flung away or knocked prone.

Name: Whelm
Description: Each creature in the $'s space must make a DC ## Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target takes bludgeoning damage. If it is a same size or smaller, it is also grappled (escape DC ##). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the $'s space. The $ can grapple one same size creature or up to two one size smaller or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the $'s turns, each target grappled by it takes bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the $ can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a DC ## Strength check and succeeding.

Name: Lightning Breath

Name: Shadow Breath
Description: The $ exhales shadowy fire in a cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC ## Dexterity saving throw, taking necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies, and an undead shadow rises from its corpose and acts immediately after the $ on the initiative count. The shadow is under the $'s control.

Name: Hellfire Orb
Description: The $ hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet. Each creature in a sphere centered on that point must make a DC ## Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes fire damage and necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Name: Lightning Strike
Description: The $ hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC ## Dexterity saving throw, taking lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

Name: Acid Spray
Description: The $ spits acid in a line, provided that it has no creature grappled. Each creature in that line must make a DC ## Dexterity saving throw, taking acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Name: Create Whirlwind
Description: A 5-foot radius, 30-foot tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the $ can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the $ maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the $ that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a DC ## Strength saving throw or be restrained by it. The $ can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures restrained by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the $ loses sight of it. A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a DC ## Strength check. If the check succeeds, the $ is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

Name: Fetid Cloud
Description: A sphere of disgusting green gas extends out from the $. The gas spreads around corners and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. Any creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can't take reactions.

Name: Darkness Aura
Description: A sphere of magical darkness extends out from the $, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the $ maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this dakrness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any other darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of # level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

Name: Stench
Description: Any creature other than a same creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the $ must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the $'s next turn. On a successful saving throw, the $ is immune to the stench of all creatures for 1 hour.

Name: Blinding Dust
Description: Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around the $. Each creature within 5 feet of the $ must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the $'s next turn.

Name: Stench Spray
Description: Each creature in a cone originating from the $ must succeed on a DC ## Dexterity saving throw or be coated in a foul-smelling liquid. A coated creature exudes a horrible stench for 1d4 hours. The coated creature is poisoned as long as the stench lasts, and other creatures are poisoned while within 5 feet of the coated creature. A creature can remove the stench on itself by using a short rest to bathe in water, alchohol, or vinegar.

Name: Frightful Presence
Description: Each creature of the $'s choice that is within ## feet of the $ and aware of it must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the $ is immune to the $'s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

Name: Moan
Description: Each creature within 60 feet of the $ that can hear its moan and that isn't an abberation must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the end of the $'s next turn. If the $'s saving throw is successful, the $ is immune to the $'s moan for the next 24 hours.

Name: Horrifying Visage
Description: Each non-undead creature within ## feet of the $ that can see it must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the $ is within line of sight, ending the effect on itsefl on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the $'s Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

Name: Entangling Plants
Description: Grasping roots and vines sprout in a sphere centered on the $, withering away after 1 minute. For the duration, that area is difficult terrain for nonplant creatures. In addition, each creature of the blight's choice in that area when the plants appear must succeed on a DC ## Strength saving throw or become restrained. Name: Gibbering
Description: The $ babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the $ and can hear the sound must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the $ can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls for the action during their turn as if under the effect of the confusion spell.

Name: Negative Energy Cone
Description: The $ creates an invisible, magical ##-foot cone/square/circle of negative energy. At the start of eah of its turns, the $ decides which way the area faces and whether it is active. Any creature in that area can't regain hit points. Any humanoid that dies there becomes a zombie under the $'s command. The dead humanoid retains its place in the initiative order and animates at the start of its next turn, provided that its body hasn't been completely destroyed.

Name: Hallucination Spores
Description: The $ ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is incapacitated while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Name: Pacifying Spores
Description: The $ ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success.

Name: Howl
Description: The $ emits a bloodcurdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of the $ that can hear the howl must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the $ is frightened until the end of its next turn.

Name: Stunning Screech

Name: Roar
Description: The $ emits a magical roar. Each time it roars before finishing a long rest, the roar is louder and the effect is different. Each creature within 500 feet of the $ and able to hear the roar must make a saving throw. On the first roar, each creature that fails a DC ## Wisdom saving throw is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end fo each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On the second roar, each creature that fails a DC ## Wisdom saving throw is deafened and frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature is paralyzed and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On the third roar, each creature makes a DC ## Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes thunder damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the $ takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

If the $ dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

Description: The $ makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

Description: The $ makes one bite attack.

Description: The $ makes one tentacle attack.

Description: The $ slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a DC ## Strength saving throw or take bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the $'s next turn. Description: The $ targets one creature it can see within 10 feet of it that has a brain. The target must succeed on a DC ## Intelligence saving throw against this magic or take psychic damage. Also on a failure, roll 3d6: If the total equals or exceeds the target's Intelligence score, the score is reduced to 0. The target is stunned until it regains at least one point of Intelligence.

Name: Chilling Gaze
Description: The $ targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the $, the target must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw against this magic or take cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute unless it is immune to cold damage. Name: Rotting Gaze
Description: The $ targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw against this magic or take necrotic damage.

Name: Death Glare
Description: The $ targets one frightened creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the $, it must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

Name: Fling
Description: The $ uses its Fling.

Name: Eye Ray
Description: The $ uses one random eye ray.

Name: Paralyzing Touch
Description: The $ uses paralyzing touch.

Name: Nightmare Haunting
Description: While on the Ethereal Plane, the $ magically touches a sleeping humanoid on the Material Plane. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the target prevents this contact, as does a magic circle. As long as the contact persists, the target has dreadful visions. If these visions last for at least 1 hour, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced. If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and if the target was evil, its soul is trapped in the $'s soul bag. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by a greater restoration spell or similar magic.

Name: Curse of the Evil Eye
Description: With a stare, the $ uses Evil Eye, but on a failed save, the $ is also cursed with magical deformaties. While deformed, the $ has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity. The transformed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on a success.

Name: Intoxicating Touch
Description: Melee spell attack. If hit, the target is magically cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and ability checks.

Name: Paralyzing Touch
Description: Melee spell attack. If hit, the target must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Name: Glaive
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit and the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or lose hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the $ hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases. Any creature can take the medicine action to staunch the wound with a successful DC ## Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target recieves magical healing.

Name: Tusks
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit and the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereboar lycanthropy.

Name: Crush
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit and the target is one size larger than creature or smaller, it attaches to the target, has advantage on attack rolls against the target, and can be detached by making a successful DC ## Strength check as an action.

Name: Maul
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit and the target is one size larger than creature or smaller, it must succeed on a DC ## Strength check or be knocked prone.

Name: Pincer Staff
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit, and same size or smaller, the target is grappled (escape DC ##). Until this grapple ends, the $ can't use its pincer staff on another target.

Name: Touch
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit, and the target is a ceature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until the $ takes an action to douse the fire, it takes fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Name: Tendrils
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit, at the end of each of its turns, the target must make a DC ## Constitution saving throw, taking acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

Name: Smother
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit, the $ is grappled (escape DC ##). Until this graple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the $ can't smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes bludgeoning damage.

Name: Pincer
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit, the target is grappled (escape DC ##) if it is a same size as creature or smaller creature and the $ doesn't have two other creatures grappled.

Name: Chain
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit, the target is grappled (escape DC ##) if the $ isn't already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

Name: Rotting Fist
Description: Melee weapon attack. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throwor be cursed with rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

Name: Shield Bash
Description: Melee weapon attack. If the target is one size larger or smaller, it must succeed on a DC ## Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Name: Fling
Description: One reasonably smaller creature held or grappled by the $ is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC ## Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

Name: Hurl Flame
Description: Ranged spell attack. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

Name: Net
Description: Ranged weapon attack. If hit, and large or smaller, the target is restrained.  Creature can use its action to make a DC ## Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing slashing damage to the net (AC 10) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

Name: Poisoned Dart
Description: Ranged weapon attack. If hit, the target must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Name: Adhesive
Description: The $ adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC ##). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

Name: Strength Drain
Description: Melee weapon attack. If hit, the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non-evil human dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpose 1d4 hours later.

Name: Incite Rampage
Description: One creature that the $ can see within 30 feet of it can use its reaction to make a melee attack if it can hear the $ and has the Rampage trait.

Name: Shimmering Shield
Description: The $ creates a shimmering, magical field around itself or another creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target gains a bonus to AC until the end of the $'s next turn.

Name: Healing Touch
Description: The $ touches another creature. The target magically regains hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

Name: Haste
Description: Until the end of its next turn, the $ magically gains +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its primary attack as a bonus action.,

Name: Shield
Description: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the $'s amulet, the $ grants a bonus to the wearer's AC if the $ is within 5 feet of the wearer.

Name: Rapport Spores
Description: A sphere of spores extends from the $. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that arent undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telephathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

Name: Probing Telepathy
Description: If a creature communicates telepathically with the $, the $ learns the $'s greatest desires if the $ can see it.

Name: Telepathic Bond

The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the $ is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Name: Fiendish Charm
Description: One humanoid that the $ can see within 30 feet must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saivng throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed creature obeys the $'s spoken commands. If the target suffers any harm from the $ or another creature or receives a suicidal command from the $, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the $ is immune to the $'s Fiendish Charm for the next 24 hours.

Name: Possession
Description: One humanoid that the $ can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC ## Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the $; the $ then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The $ now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The $ can't be targeted by an attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the $ ends it as a bonus action, or the $ is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the $ reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this creature's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

Name: Mud Berath
Description: The $ belches viscid mud onto one creature within 5 feet of it. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a DC ## Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Name: Frightening Gaze
Description: The $ fixes its gaze on one creature that it can see within 10 feet of it.  The target must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the $'s gaze for the next 24 hours.

Name: Sleep Gaze
Description: The $ gazes at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC ## Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target succumbs to a magical slumber, falling unconscious for 10 minutes or until someone uses an action to shake the target awake. A creature that successfully saves against the effect is immune to this creature's gaze for the next 24 hours. Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren't effected by it.

Name: Vengeful Glare
Description: The $ targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a DC ## Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed until the $ deals damage to it, or until the end of the $'s next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of the $ for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the $, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

Name: Blinding Gaze
Description: The $ targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see it, the target must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be blinded until magic such as the lesser restoration spell removes the blindness.

Description: The $ targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed no a DC ## Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the $.

Name: Dreadful Glare
Description: The $ targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the $, it must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the $'s next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all similar creatures for the next 24 hours.

Name: Charm
Description: The $ targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the $, the target must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the $. The charmed target regards the $ as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Each time the $ or the creatur's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existance than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

Name: Fey Charm
Description: The $ targets one humanoid or beast that it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the $, it must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the $ as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the $'s control, it takes the $'s requests or actions in the most favorable way it can. Each time the $ or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the $ dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the $'s Fey Charm for the next 24 hours. The $ can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.

Name: Unnerving Mask
Description: When a creature the $ can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the $, the $ can create the illusion that it looks like one of the $'s departed loved ones or bitter enemies. If the $ can see the $, it must succeed on a DC ## Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its next turn.

Name: Corrosive Form
Description: A creature that touches the $ or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the $ corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunication made of metal or wood that hits the $ is destroyed after dealing damage. The $ can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

Name: Elemental Body
Description: A creature that touches the $ or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes type damage.

Name: Reflective Carapace
Description: Any time the $ is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the $ is unaffected. On a 6, the $ is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the $, turning the caster into the target.

Name: Barbed Hide
Description: At the start of each of its turns, the $ deals piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

Name: Elemental Aura
Description: At the start of each of the $'s turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes type damage. If fire: Flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the $ or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes fire damage.

Name: Legendary Resistance
Description: If the $ fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Name: Avoidance
Description: If the $ is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

Name: Spell Reflection
Description: If the $ makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses it, the $ can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 30 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the spectator. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

Name: Fiendish Blessing
Description: The AC of the $ includes its Charisma modifier.

Name: Parry
Description: The $ adds # to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the $ must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Name: Axiomatic Mind
Description: The $ can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

Name: Steadfast
Description: The $ can't be frightened while it can see an allied creature within 30 feet of it.

Name: Antimagic Cone
Description: The $ creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in an ##-foot cone/square/circle. At the start of each of its turns, the $ decides which way the shape faces and whether it is active. The area works against the $'s magic and magical effects.

Name: Slippery
Description: The $ has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

Name: Magic Resistance
Description: The $ has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Name: Turn Resistance
Description: The $ has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

Name: Dark Devotion
Description: The $ has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Name: Fey Ancestry
Description: The $ has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the $ to sleep.

Name: Brave
Description: The $ has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Name: Sure-Footed
Description: The $ has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

Name: Inscrutable
Description: The $ is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any diviniation spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the $'s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

Name: Immutable Form
Description: The $ is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Name: Turn Immunity
Description: The $ is immune to effects that turn undead.

Name: Shielded Mind
Description: The $ is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

Name: Phantasms
Description: The $ magically creates three illusory duplicates of itself if it isn't in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting positions so as to make it impossible to track which is the real one. If the $ is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear. Whenever any creature targets the $ with an attack or harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the $ or one of its duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can't see or if it relies on senses other than sight. A duplicate has the $'s AC and uses its saving throws. If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a saving throw against an effect that deals damage, hte duplicate disappears.

Description: The $ magically regains hit points.

Name: Displacement
Description: The $ projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the $ is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

Name: Regeneration
Description: The $ regains ## hit points at the start of its turn. If the $ takes type damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the $'s next turn. The $ dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

Name: Sticky Shield
Description: When a creature misses the $ with a melee weapon attack, the $ uses its sticky shield to catch the weapon. The attacker must succeed on a DC ## Strength saving throw, or the weapon becomes stuck to the shield. If the weapon's wielder can't or won't let go of the weapon, the wielder is grappled while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon can't be used. A creature can pull the weapon free by taking an action to make a DC ## Strength check and succeeding.

Name: Redirect Attack
Description: When a creature that the $ can see targets it with an attack, the goblin chooses another similar creature within 5 feet of it. The two creatures swap places, and the chosen creature becomes the target instead.

Name: Damage Absorption
Description: Whenever the $ is subjected to type damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the type damage dealt.

Name: Damage Transfer
Description: While it is grappling a creature, the $ takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the $ grappled by the $ takes the other half.

Name: Psychic Defense
Description: While the $ is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

Name: Mucous Cloud
Description: While underwater, the $ is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the $ or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a DC ## Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the $ is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

Name: Two Heads
Description: The $ has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

Name: Hellish Rejuvination
Description: A creature that dies in the Nine Hells comes back to life with all its hit points in 1d10 days unless it is killed by a good-aligned creature with a bless spell cast on that creature or its remains are sprinkled with holy water.

Name: Undead Fortitude
Description: If damage reduces the $ to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the $ drops to 1 hit point instead.

Name: Rejuvination
Description: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed creature gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

Name: Relentless
Description: If the $ takes ## damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit points instead.

Name: Aggressive
Description: As a bonus action, the $ can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

Name: Cunning Action
Description: On each of its turns, the $ can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

Name: Tree Stride
Description: Once on its turn, the $ can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within its reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearingin in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be once size bigger or bigger.

Name: Ethereal Stride
Description: The $ and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

Name: Earth Glide
Description: The $ can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the $ doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

Name: Tunneler
Description: The $ can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5-foot wide, 8-foot high tunnel in its wake.

Name: Spider Climb
Description: The $ can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Name: Elemental Form
Description: The $ can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Name: Icy Walk
Description: The $ can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doens't cost it extra movement.

Name: Amorphous
Description: The $ can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Name: Incorporeal Movement
Description: The $ can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Name: Swarm
Description: The $ can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the $ can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The $ can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

Name: Nimble Escape
Description: The $ can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

Name: Flyby
Description: The $ doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

Name: Flight
Description: The $ flies up to half its flying speed.

Name: Web Walker
Description: The $ ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

Name: Etherealness
Description: The $ magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane or vice versa. To do so, the $ must have a heartstone in her possession.

Name: Teleport
Description: The $ magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Name: Teleport
Description: The $ magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Name: Whirlwind of Sand
Description: The $ magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the $ is immune to all damage, and it can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned. Equipment worn or carried by the $ remains in its possession.

Name: Move
Description: The $ moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Name: Mist Form
Description: The $ transforms into toxic mist or reverts to its true form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is also transformed. It reverts to its true for if it dies. While in mist form, the $ is incapacitated and can't speak. It has a flying speed of 30 feet, can hover, and can pass through any space that isn't airtight. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to nonmagical damage. While in mist form, the $ can enter a creature's space and stop there. Each time that creature starts its turn with the $ in the same space, the $ must make a DC ## Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated.

Name: Running Leap
Description: The $'s long jump is up to ## feet and its high jump is up to ## feet when it has a running start.

Name: Standing Leap
Description: The $'s long jump is up to ## feet and its high jump is up to ## feet, with or without a running start.

Name: Brute
Description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the $ hits with it (included in the attack).

Name: Reckless
Description: At the start of its turn, the $ can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

Name: Assassinate
Description: During its first turn, the $ has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the $ scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

Name: Enlarge
Description: For 1 minute, the $ magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the $ is one size larger, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strenght saving throws with advantage. If the $ lacks the room to become one size larger, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

Name: Petrifying Gaze
Description: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the $ and the two of them can see each other, the $ can force the $ to make a DC ## Constitution saving throw if the $ isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the $ magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the $ is petrified until freed by greater restoration or other magic. A creature that isn't surprised can avert their eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the $ until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the $ in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If the $ sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

Name: Dive
Description: If the $ is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra type damage to the target.

Name: Surprise Attack
Description: If the $ surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra damage from the attack.

Name: Reactive
Description: The $ can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

Name: Antannae
Description: The $ corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the $ can make a DC ## Dexterity saving throw to avoid the $'s touch. If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offercs. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to +0 is destroyed. If the object touched is a held weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

Name: Siege Monster
Description: The $ deals double damage to objects and structures.

Name: Pack Tactics
Description: The $ has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the $'s allies is within 5 feet of the $ and the ally isn't incapacitated.

Name: Grappler
Description: The $ has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

Name: Ambusher
Description: The $ has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

Name: Blood Frenzy
Description: The $ has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

Name: Magic Weapons
Description: The $'s weapon attacks are magical.

Name: Angelic Weapons
Description: The $'s weapon attacks are magical. When the $ hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra radiant damage (included in the attack).

Name: Elemental Weapon
Description: When the $ hits with a melee weapon, it deals an extra type damage (included in the attack).

Name: Rampage
Description: When the $ reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the $ can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make an attack.

Name: Berserk
Description: When the $ starts its turn with ## hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the $ goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the $ attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the $ attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the $ goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

Name: Wounded Fury
Description: While it has ## hit points or fewer, the $ has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

Name: Devil Sight
Description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the $'s darkvision.

Name: Detect Life
Description: The $ can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to # miles away. It knows the general direction they're in, but not their exact location.

Name: Otherworldly Perception
Description: The $ can sense the preseence of any creature within 30 feet of it that is invisible or on the Ethereal Plane. It can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

Name: Blind Senses
Description: The $ can't use its blindsight while deafened and unable to smell.

Name: Echolocation
Description: The $ can't use its blindsight while deafened.

Name: Keen Senses
Description: The $ has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sense.

Name: Faultless Tracker
Description: The $ is given a quarry by its summoner. The $ knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The $ also knows the location of its summoner.

Name: Divine Awareness
Description: The $ knows if it hears a lie.

Name: Read Thoughts
Description: The $ magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in rage, the $ can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the $'s concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the $ has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

Name: Detect
Description: The $ makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

Name: Sense Magic
Description: The $ senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn't itself magical.

Name: Weird Insight
Description: The $ targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma (Deception) check against the $'s Wisdom (Insight) check. If the $ wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being charmed.

Name: Heart Sight
Description: The $ touches a creature and magically knows the $'s current emotional state. If the target fails a DC ## Charisma saving throw, the $ also knows the $'s alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

Name: Shapechanger
Description: The $ can use its action to polymorph into a beast-humanoid hybrid or into a beast, or back into its true from, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying ins't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

Name: Illusory Appearance
Description: The $ covers itself and anything they are wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes it look like another creature of its general size and shape. The illusion ends if the $ takes a bonus action to end it or if it dies. The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the $ could appear to have smooth skin, but somone touching it would feel its flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an actino to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC ## Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

Name: Change Shape
Description: The $ magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a hallenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the $'s choice). In a new form, the $ retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

Name: Misty Escape
Description: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the $ transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn't in problem terrain such as sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed. While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its original form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 horu in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

Name: Spell Storing
Description: A spellcaster who wears the $'s amulet can cause the $ to store one spell of the #th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the $. The spell has no effect but is stored within the $. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the $ casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

Name: Elemental Demise
Description: If the $ dies, its body disappears in an appropriate fashion, leaving behind only equipment the $ was wearing or carrying.

Name: Amphibious
Description: The $ can breathe air and water.

Name: Confer Elemental Resistance
Description: The $ can grant resistance to type damage to anyone riding it.

Name: Hold Breath
Description: The $ can hold its breath for ## minutes.

Name: Mimicry
Description: The $ can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC ## Wisdom (Insight) check.

Name: Labyrinthine Recall
Description: The $ can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

Name: Ephemeral
Description: The $ can't wear or carry anything.

Name: Body Thief
Description: The $ initiates an Intelligence contest with an incapacitated humanoid within 5 feet of it. If it wins the contest, the $ magically consumes the target's brain, teleports into the target's skull, and takes control of the target's body. While inside a creature, the $ has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside its host. The $ retains its intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as its understanding of Deep Speech, its telepathy, and its traits. It otherwise adopts the target's statistics. It knows everything that the $ knew, including spells and languages. If the host body drops to 0 hit points, the $ must leave it. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the body drives the $ out. The $ is also forced out if the target regains its devoured brain by means of wish. By spending 5 feet of its movement, the $ can voluntarily leave the body, teleporting to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The body then dies, unless its brain is restored within 1 round.

Name: Beast of Burden
Description: The $ is considered to be a one size larger animal for the purpose of determinng its carrying capacity.

Name: Create Food and Water
Description: The $ magically creates enough food and water to sustain itself for 24 hours.

Name: Wall of Ice
Description: The $ magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 60 feet of it. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or a hemispherical domeup to 20 feet in diameter. When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The $ chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the $ is incapacitated. The $ then makes a DC ## Dexterity saving throw, taking cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the $ is incapacitated or dies. The wall can be damaged and breached; each 10-foot section has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. Whenever a creature finishes moving through the frigid air on a turn, willingly or otherwise, the $ must make a DC ## Constitution saving throw, taking cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The frigid air dissipates when the rest of the wall vanishes.

Name: Engulf
Description: The $ moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter a same size or smaller creature's spaces. Whenever the $ enters a creature's space, the $ must make a DC ## Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the $ can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed back suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw. On a failed save, the cube enters the $'s space, and the $ takes acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is restrained, and takes acid damage at the start of each of the $'s turns. When the $ moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC ## Strength check. On a success, the $ escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the $.

Name: Flying Sword
Description: The $ releases its greatsword to hover magically in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. If the $ can see the sword, the $ can mentally command it as a bonus action to fly up to 50 feet and either make one attack against a target or return to the $'s hands. If the hovering sword is targeted by an effect, the $ is considered to be holding it. The hovering sword falls if the $ dies.

Name: Illumination
Description: The $ sheds either dim light in a sphere, or bright light in a sphere and dim light for an distance. It can switch between the options as an action.

Name: Animate Chains
Description: Up to four chains the $ can see within 60 feet of it magically sprout razor-edged barbs and animate under the $'s control, provided that the chains aren't being worn or carried. Each animated chain is an object with AC 20, 20 hit points, resistance to piercing damage, and immunity to psychic and thunder damage. When the $ uses Multiattack on its turn, it can use each animated chain to make one additional chain attack. An animated chain can grapple one creature on its own but can't make attacks while grappling. An animated chain reverts to its inanimate state if reduced to 0 hit points or if the $ is incapacited or dies.

Name: Split
Description: When a creature that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new similar creatures if it has at least ## hit points. Each new creature has hit points equal to half the original, rounded down. New creatures are one size smaller than the original.

Name: Shriek
Description: When bright light or a creature is within 30 feet of the $, it emits a shriek audible within 300 feet of it. The $ continues to shriek until the disturbance moves out of range and for 1d4 of the $'s turns afterwards.

Name: Distress Spores
Description: When the $ takes damage, all other similar creatures within 240 feet of it can sense its pain.

Name: Cast Spell
Description: The $ casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

Name: Cantrip
Description: The $ casts a cantrip.

Name: Innate Spellcasting
Description: The $ is a ##th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is ability (spell save DC ##, +## to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The $ has the following class spells prepared: ##

Name: Spellcasting
Description: The $ is an ##th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC ##, +## to hit with spell attacks). The $ has the following class spells prepared:

Name: Superior Invisibility
Description: As a bonus action, the $ can magically turn invisible until its concentration ends (as if concetrating on a spell). Any equipment that the $ wears or carries is invisible with it.

Name: Terrain Camoflauge
Description: The $ has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in type terrain.

Name: Chameleon Skin
Description: The $ has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

Name: Invisible in Element
Description: The $ is invisible while fully immersed in its appropriate element.

Name: Invisibility
Description: The $ magiaclly turns invisible until it attacks or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the $ wears or carries is invisible with it.

Name: Invisible Passage
Description: The $ magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until their concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, it leaves no physical evidence of its passage, so it can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment it wears or carries is invisible with it.

Name: Superior Invisibility
Description: The $ magically turns invisible until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the $ wears or carries is invisible with it.

Name: Shadow Stealth
Description: While in dim light or darkness, the $ can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

Name: False Appearance
Description: While the $ remains motionless, it is indistiguishable from an appropriate inanimate object.

Name: Ink Cloud
Description: A sphere of ink extends all around the $ if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, althouth a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the $ can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

Name: Transparent
Description: Even when the $ is in plain sight, it takes a successful DC ## Wisdom (Perception) check to spot the $ that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the $'s space while unaware of the $ is surprised by the $.

Name: Summon Demon
Description: The $ attempts to magically summon a yochlol with a 30 percent chance of success. If the attempt fails, the $ takes psychic damage. Otherwise, the summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

Name: Animate Trees
Description: The $ magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the $. The tree remains animated for 1 day or until it dies; until the $ dies or is more than 120 feet away from the tree; or until the $ takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

Name: Animate Boulder
Description: The $ magically animates up to two boulders it can see within 60 feet. A boulder has statistics like those of a galeb duhr, except it has Intelligence 1 and Charisma 1, it can't be charmed or frightened, and it lacks this action option. A boulder remains animated as long as the $ maintains concentration, up to 1 minute (as if concentrating on a spell).

Name: Children of the Night
Description: The $ magically calls 2d4 swarms of bats or rats, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the $ can call 3d6 wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the $ and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the $ dies, or until the $ dismisses them as a bonus action.

Name: Life Drain
Description: The $ makes a melee attack on the target. If it hits, the target must succeed on a DC ## Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the $'s control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The $ can have no more than ## zombies under its control at one time.

Name: Create Specter
Description: The $ targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the $'s control. The $ can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

Name: Animating Spores
Description: The $ targets one corpose of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for 1d4+1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

Name: Water Susceptibilty
Description: For every 5 feet the $ moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

Name: Freeze
Description: If the $ takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

Name: Fear of Element
Description: If the $ takes type damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Name: Element Bound
Description: The $ dies if it leaves its appropriate element to which it is bound or if its element is destroyed.

Name: Poor Depth Perception
Description: The $ has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 feet away.

Name: Antimagic Susceptible
Description: The $ is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the $ must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconcious for 1 minute.

Name: Light Sensitivity
Description: While in a bright light, the $ has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Name: Sun Sickness
Description: While in sunlight, the $ has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The $ dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Description: While in sunlight, the $ has disadvantage on all attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

Name: Tunneler
Description: The $ can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.
